option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"/Users/tejsingh/Documents/Java/ExamSite":"{\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/resources/QuestionResource.java\":\"This file is a Spring Boot REST controller that handles CRUD operations for questions and options in a test paper application.\\n\\n`QuestionResource`: A REST controller class that provides endpoints for creating, updating, and retrieving questions and their associated options.\\n\\n`createQuestion`: Creates a new question with a unique ID and saves it to the database.\\n`addOrUpdateOptions`: Adds or updates options for a given question, ensuring that the question\\u0027s constraints (single or multi-correct) are met.\\n`getQuestion`: Retrieves a question and its associated options from the database.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/dto/QuestionResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `QuestionResponse`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent a question in a test paper.\\n\\n`QuestionResponse`: A DTO class that represents a question in a test paper, including its ID, stem, whether it allows multiple correct answers, and a list of options.\\n\\n`QuestionResponse()`: The default constructor for the `QuestionResponse` class.\\n\\n`QuestionResponse(String, String, Boolean, List\\u003cOptionResponse\\u003e)`: A constructor for the `QuestionResponse` class that takes in the question\\u0027s ID, stem, whether it allows multiple correct answers, and a list of options.\\n\\n`getId()`: Returns the ID of the question.\\n\\n`setId(String)`: Sets the ID of the question.\\n\\n`getStem()`: Returns the stem (question text) of the question.\\n\\n`setStem(String)`: Sets the stem (question text) of the question.\\n\\n`getMultiCorrect()`: Returns whether the question allows multiple correct answers.\\n\\n`setMultiCorrect(Boolean)`: Sets whether the question allows multiple correct answers.\\n\\n`getOptions()`: Returns the list of options for the question.\\n\\n`setOptions(List\\u003cOptionResponse\\u003e)`: Sets the list of options for the question.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/model/Tag.java\":\"This file defines a `Tag` class, which represents a tag associated with a question in a test paper application.\\n\\n`Tag`: This class represents a tag that can be associated with one or more questions in a test paper application.\\n\\n`getId()`: Returns the unique identifier of the tag.\\n`setId(Long id)`: Sets the unique identifier of the tag.\\n`getName()`: Returns the name of the tag.\\n`setName(String name)`: Sets the name of the tag.\\n`getDescription()`: Returns the description of the tag.\\n`setDescription(String description)`: Sets the description of the tag.\\n`getCreatedAt()`: Returns the date and time when the tag was created.\\n`setCreatedAt(LocalDateTime createdAt)`: Sets the date and time when the tag was created.\\n`getTagQuestions()`: Returns the list of `TagQuestion` objects associated with the tag.\\n`setTagQuestions(List\\u003cTagQuestion\\u003e tagQuestions)`: Sets the list of `TagQuestion` objects associated with the tag.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/model/Question.java\":\"This file defines a `Question` class, which represents a question in a test or exam. The class has several properties, including an ID, the question stem, a flag indicating whether multiple answers are correct, the creation timestamp, and a list of `Option` objects representing the possible answers.\\n\\n`Question`: A class that represents a question in a test or exam, with properties for the question ID, stem, whether multiple answers are correct, the creation timestamp, and a list of possible answers.\\n\\n`getId()`: Returns the ID of the question.\\n`setId(String id)`: Sets the ID of the question.\\n`getStem()`: Returns the stem (text) of the question.\\n`setStem(String stem)`: Sets the stem (text) of the question.\\n`getMultiCorrect()`: Returns whether multiple answers are correct for this question.\\n`setMultiCorrect(Boolean multiCorrect)`: Sets whether multiple answers are correct for this question.\\n`getCreatedAt()`: Returns the timestamp when the question was created.\\n`setCreatedAt(LocalDateTime createdAt)`: Sets the timestamp when the question was created.\\n`getOptions()`: Returns the list of possible answers for this question.\\n`setOptions(List\\u003cOption\\u003e options)`: Sets the list of possible answers for this question.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/dto/TagQuestionRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `TagQuestionRequest`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent a request to associate a list of question IDs with a specific tag ID.\\n\\n`TagQuestionRequest`: A DTO class that represents a request to associate a list of question IDs with a specific tag ID.\\n\\n`TagQuestionRequest()`: The default constructor for the `TagQuestionRequest` class.\\n\\n`TagQuestionRequest(Long tagId, List\\u003cString\\u003e questionIds)`: A constructor that initializes the `tagId` and `questionIds` fields of the `TagQuestionRequest` class.\\n\\n`getTagId()`: Returns the `tagId` field of the `TagQuestionRequest` class.\\n\\n`setTagId(Long tagId)`: Sets the `tagId` field of the `TagQuestionRequest` class.\\n\\n`getQuestionIds()`: Returns the `questionIds` field of the `TagQuestionRequest` class.\\n\\n`setQuestionIds(List\\u003cString\\u003e questionIds)`: Sets the `questionIds` field of the `TagQuestionRequest` class.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/model/Person.java\":\"This file defines a `Person` class, which is an entity class used for mapping to a database table named `people`.\\n\\n`Person`: A class that represents a person with an ID and a name.\\n\\n`Person()`: The default constructor for the `Person` class.\\n\\n`Person(Long id, String name)`: A constructor that initializes the `id` and `name` fields of the `Person` class.\\n\\n`getId()`: A getter method that returns the ID of the person.\\n\\n`setId(Long id)`: A setter method that sets the ID of the person.\\n\\n`getName()`: A getter method that returns the name of the person.\\n\\n`setName(String name)`: A setter method that sets the name of the person.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/repository/PersonRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single interface:\\n\\n`PersonRepository`: This interface extends the `JpaRepository` interface and provides a way to interact with the `Person` entity in the database.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any classes or functions. It defines a repository interface that provides basic CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for the `Person` entity using the Spring Data JPA framework.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/resources/PersonResource.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Boot REST controller class that handles CRUD operations for a `Person` entity.\\n\\n`PersonResource`: This class is a REST controller that provides endpoints for creating and retrieving `Person` entities.\\n\\n`create`: This function saves a new `Person` entity to the database and returns the saved entity.\\n\\n`getById`: This function retrieves a `Person` entity by its ID and returns it, or a 404 response if the entity is not found.\",\"/src/test/java/com/testpaper/demo/DemoApplicationTests.java\":\"This file is a test class for a Spring Boot application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test method that checks if the application context loads successfully.\\n\\n`DemoApplicationTests`: This is a test class that verifies the Spring Boot application context loads correctly.\\n\\n`contextLoads()`: This test method checks if the Spring Boot application context can be loaded without any issues.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/dto/QuestionRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `QuestionRequest`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent a question in a test paper.\\n\\n`QuestionRequest`: A DTO class that represents a question in a test paper, containing the question stem and a boolean flag indicating whether the question has multiple correct answers.\\n\\n`QuestionRequest()`: The default constructor for the `QuestionRequest` class.\\n\\n`QuestionRequest(String, Boolean)`: The parameterized constructor for the `QuestionRequest` class, which takes the question stem and a boolean flag indicating whether the question has multiple correct answers.\\n\\n`getStem()`: Returns the question stem.\\n\\n`setStem(String)`: Sets the question stem.\\n\\n`getMultiCorrect()`: Returns the boolean flag indicating whether the question has multiple correct answers.\\n\\n`setMultiCorrect(Boolean)`: Sets the boolean flag indicating whether the question has multiple correct answers.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/repository/QuestionRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single interface:\\n\\n`QuestionRepository`: This interface extends the `JpaRepository` interface and is used to interact with the `Question` entity in the database.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any classes or functions. It defines a repository interface that provides basic CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for the `Question` entity using the Spring Data JPA framework.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/repository/TagQuestionRepository.java\":\"This file contains a Spring Data JPA repository interface named `TagQuestionRepository` that provides methods for interacting with the `TagQuestion` entity in the database.\\n\\n`TagQuestionRepository`: An interface that extends `JpaRepository` and provides methods for querying and modifying `TagQuestion` entities.\\n\\n`findByTagId(Long tagId)`: Retrieves a list of `TagQuestion` entities with the specified `tagId`.\\n\\n`findByQuestionId(String questionId)`: Retrieves a list of `TagQuestion` entities with the specified `questionId`.\\n\\n`findByTagIdAndQuestionId(Long tagId, String questionId)`: Retrieves an optional `TagQuestion` entity with the specified `tagId` and `questionId`.\\n\\n`deleteByTagId(Long tagId)`: Deletes all `TagQuestion` entities with the specified `tagId`.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/model/TagQuestion.java\":\"This file defines a JPA entity class `TagQuestion` that represents a many-to-many relationship between `Tag` and `Question` entities.\\n\\n`TagQuestion`: A JPA entity class that represents the relationship between a `Tag` and a `Question`.\\n\\n`TagQuestion()`: The default constructor for the `TagQuestion` class.\\n\\n`TagQuestion(Tag, String)`: A constructor that takes a `Tag` and a `questionId` string to create a new `TagQuestion` instance.\\n\\n`getId()`: Returns the unique identifier of the `TagQuestion` entity.\\n\\n`setId(Long)`: Sets the unique identifier of the `TagQuestion` entity.\\n\\n`getTag()`: Returns the `Tag` associated with the `TagQuestion` entity.\\n\\n`setTag(Tag)`: Sets the `Tag` associated with the `TagQuestion` entity.\\n\\n`getTagId()`: Returns the ID of the `Tag` associated with the `TagQuestion` entity.\\n\\n`setTagId(Long)`: Sets the ID of the `Tag` associated with the `TagQuestion` entity.\\n\\n`getQuestionId()`: Returns the ID of the `Question` associated with the `TagQuestion` entity.\\n\\n`setQuestionId(String)`: Sets the ID of the `Question` associated with the `TagQuestion` entity.\\n\\n`getCreatedAt()`: Returns the date and time when the `TagQuestion` entity was created.\\n\\n`setCreatedAt(LocalDateTime)`: Sets the date and time when the `TagQuestion` entity was created.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/repository/OptionRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single interface named `OptionRepository` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface provided by Spring Data JPA.\\n\\n`OptionRepository`: An interface that provides methods for interacting with the `Option` entity in the database.\\n\\n`findByQuestionId(String questionId)`: Retrieves a list of `Option` entities associated with the specified `questionId`.\\n\\n`findByOptionId(String optionId)`: Retrieves an `Option` entity with the specified `optionId`.\\n\\n`findByQuestionIdAndOptionText(String questionId, String optionText)`: Retrieves an `Option` entity with the specified `questionId` and `optionText`.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/dto/TagRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `TagRequest`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent a tag with a name and description.\\n\\n`TagRequest`: A DTO class that represents a tag with a name and description.\\n\\n`TagRequest()`: The default constructor for the `TagRequest` class.\\n\\n`TagRequest(String name, String description)`: A constructor for the `TagRequest` class that takes a name and description as parameters.\\n\\n`getName()`: Returns the name of the tag.\\n\\n`setName(String name)`: Sets the name of the tag.\\n\\n`getDescription()`: Returns the description of the tag.\\n\\n`setDescription(String description)`: Sets the description of the tag.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/resources/TagResource.java\":\"This file is a Spring Boot REST controller that handles CRUD operations for tags and their associated questions.\\n\\n`TagResource`: This class is a REST controller that provides endpoints for creating tags, assigning questions to tags, and retrieving questions associated with a tag.\\n\\n`createTag`: This function creates a new tag in the system, ensuring that the tag name is unique.\\n\\n`assignQuestionsToTag`: This function assigns a list of question IDs to a specific tag, verifying the existence of the tag and the questions before creating or updating the tag-question mappings.\\n\\n`getQuestionsByTag`: This function retrieves all the question IDs associated with a specific tag, verifying the existence of the tag before returning the response.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/dto/TagQuestionResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `TagQuestionResponse`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent the response from a service that retrieves tag-related question information.\\n\\n`TagQuestionResponse`: A DTO class that holds the tag ID, tag name, and a list of associated question IDs.\\n\\n`TagQuestionResponse()`: The default constructor for the `TagQuestionResponse` class.\\n\\n`TagQuestionResponse(Long, String, List\\u003cString\\u003e)`: The parameterized constructor for the `TagQuestionResponse` class, which initializes the tag ID, tag name, and list of question IDs.\\n\\n`getTagId()`: Returns the tag ID.\\n\\n`setTagId(Long)`: Sets the tag ID.\\n\\n`getTagName()`: Returns the tag name.\\n\\n`setTagName(String)`: Sets the tag name.\\n\\n`getQuestionIds()`: Returns the list of question IDs.\\n\\n`setQuestionIds(List\\u003cString\\u003e)`: Sets the list of question IDs.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/model/Option.java\":\"This file defines the `Option` class, which is an entity class used for storing information about the options associated with a question in a test paper.\\n\\n`Option`: This class represents an option for a question in a test paper, with properties such as the option ID, the associated question, the option text, and whether the option is correct or not.\\n\\n`getOptionId()`: Returns the unique identifier of the option.\\n`setOptionId(String optionId)`: Sets the unique identifier of the option.\\n`getQuestion()`: Returns the question associated with the option.\\n`setQuestion(Question question)`: Sets the question associated with the option and updates the question ID.\\n`getQuestionId()`: Returns the ID of the question associated with the option.\\n`setQuestionId(String questionId)`: Sets the ID of the question associated with the option.\\n`getOptionText()`: Returns the text of the option.\\n`setOptionText(String optionText)`: Sets the text of the option.\\n`getIsCorrect()`: Returns whether the option is the correct answer.\\n`setIsCorrect(Boolean isCorrect)`: Sets whether the option is the correct answer.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/repository/TagRepository.java\":\"This file contains a single interface named `TagRepository` that extends the `JpaRepository` interface provided by Spring Data JPA.\\n\\n`TagRepository`: This interface provides methods for interacting with the `Tag` entity in the database.\\n\\n`findByName(String name)`: This method returns an `Optional` containing the `Tag` entity with the specified name, if it exists in the database.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/util/IdGenerator.java\":\"This file contains a utility class `IdGenerator` that provides two methods for generating unique identifiers.\\n\\n`IdGenerator`: A utility class that generates unique identifiers.\\n\\n`generateRandomId(int length)`: Generates a random alphanumeric string of the specified length.\\n\\n`generateHashBasedId(String input)`: Generates a hash-based identifier from the provided input string.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/dto/OptionResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `OptionResponse`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent an option for a question in a test paper.\\n\\n`OptionResponse`: A DTO class that represents an option for a question in a test paper, including the option ID, question ID, option text, and whether the option is correct.\\n\\n`OptionResponse()`: The default constructor for the `OptionResponse` class.\\n\\n`OptionResponse(String, String, String, Boolean)`: A constructor for the `OptionResponse` class that takes in the option ID, question ID, option text, and a boolean indicating whether the option is correct.\\n\\n`getOptionId()`: Returns the option ID.\\n\\n`setOptionId(String)`: Sets the option ID.\\n\\n`getQuestionId()`: Returns the question ID.\\n\\n`setQuestionId(String)`: Sets the question ID.\\n\\n`getOptionText()`: Returns the option text.\\n\\n`setOptionText(String)`: Sets the option text.\\n\\n`getIsCorrect()`: Returns a boolean indicating whether the option is correct.\\n\\n`setIsCorrect(Boolean)`: Sets a boolean indicating whether the option is correct.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/dto/TagResponse.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `TagResponse`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent a tag entity in the application.\\n\\n`TagResponse`: A DTO class that represents a tag with an ID, name, description, and creation timestamp.\\n\\n`TagResponse()`: The default constructor for the `TagResponse` class.\\n\\n`TagResponse(Long, String, String, LocalDateTime)`: The parameterized constructor for the `TagResponse` class, which initializes the class properties.\\n\\n`getId()`: Returns the ID of the tag.\\n\\n`setId(Long)`: Sets the ID of the tag.\\n\\n`getName()`: Returns the name of the tag.\\n\\n`setName(String)`: Sets the name of the tag.\\n\\n`getDescription()`: Returns the description of the tag.\\n\\n`setDescription(String)`: Sets the description of the tag.\\n\\n`getCreatedAt()`: Returns the creation timestamp of the tag.\\n\\n`setCreatedAt(LocalDateTime)`: Sets the creation timestamp of the tag.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/resources/SampleResource.java\":\"This file contains a single class and one function.\\n\\n`SampleResource`: This class is a REST controller that provides a simple API endpoint.\\n\\n`getSample()`: This function returns a string \\\"Sample text\\\" when the \\\"/api/sample\\\" endpoint is accessed.\\n\\nOverall, this file defines a simple Spring Boot REST controller that exposes a single endpoint to return a sample text response.\",\"/compose.yaml\":\"This file is a Docker Compose configuration that sets up a MySQL database service. It does not contain any classes or functions. The file defines a single service named \\\"mysql\\\" that runs the latest version of the MySQL Docker image. The service is configured with environment variables to create a database named \\\"mydatabase\\\", set the password for the \\\"myuser\\\" user, and set the root password. The service also exposes the MySQL port 3306.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/dto/OptionRequest.java\":\"This file contains a single class, `OptionRequest`, which is a data transfer object (DTO) used to represent an option for a test question.\\n\\n`OptionRequest`: A DTO class that represents an option for a test question, containing an option ID, option text, and a boolean flag indicating whether the option is correct.\\n\\n`OptionRequest()`: The default constructor for the `OptionRequest` class.\\n\\n`OptionRequest(String, String, Boolean)`: A constructor for the `OptionRequest` class that takes an option ID, option text, and a boolean flag indicating whether the option is correct.\\n\\n`getOptionId()`: Returns the option ID.\\n\\n`setOptionId(String)`: Sets the option ID.\\n\\n`getOptionText()`: Returns the option text.\\n\\n`setOptionText(String)`: Sets the option text.\\n\\n`getIsCorrect()`: Returns the boolean flag indicating whether the option is correct.\\n\\n`setIsCorrect(Boolean)`: Sets the boolean flag indicating whether the option is correct.\",\"/src/main/java/com/testpaper/demo/DemoApplication.java\":\"This file is a Spring Boot application that serves as the entry point for the application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather sets up the Spring Boot application and starts the application.\\n\\nThe file does the following:\\n\\n1. Imports the necessary Spring Boot classes and annotations.\\n2. Defines the `DemoApplication` class, which is annotated with `@SpringBootApplication`, indicating that it is a Spring Boot application.\\n3. Provides the `main()` method, which is the entry point of the application and calls the `SpringApplication.run()` method to start the application.\",\"/HELP.md\":\"This file does not contain any classes or functions. Instead, it provides a \\\"Getting Started\\\" guide for a Spring Boot project, which includes the following sections:\\n\\n1. Reference Documentation: Provides links to various Spring Boot and Maven documentation resources.\\n2. Guides: Lists a few guides that illustrate how to use some features of the project, such as accessing relational data using JDBC and MySQL.\\n3. GraphQL code generation with DGS: Explains how the project has been configured to use the Netflix DGS Codegen plugin for generating client files for accessing remote GraphQL services.\\n4. Docker Compose support: Describes the Docker Compose file included in the project, which defines a MySQL service.\\n5. Maven Parent overrides: Discusses how the project POM contains empty overrides for certain elements inherited from the parent POM, such as `\\u003clicense\\u003e` and `\\u003cdevelopers\\u003e`.\"}"}
